info.title: DESDEO (fast)API
info.description: A rest API for the DESDEO framework.

get.description:
Return information about the current user.

Args:
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): user dependency, handled by `get_current_user`.

Returns:
    UserPublic: public information about the current user.

post.description:
Login to get an authentication token.

Return an access token in the response and a cookie storing a refresh token.

Args:
    form_data (Annotated[OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, Depends()]):
        The form data to authenticate the user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_db)]): The database session.
    cookie_max_age (int): the lifetime of the cookie storing the refresh token.

Log the current user out. Deletes the refresh token that was set by logging in.

Args:
    None

Returns:
    JSONResponse: A response in which the cookies are deleted

Refresh the access token using the refresh token stored in the cookie.

Args:
    request (Request): The request containing the cookie.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_db)]): the database session.
    refresh_token (Annotated[Str | None, Cookie()]): the refresh
        token, which is fetched from a cookie included in the response.

Returns:
    dict: A dictionary containing the new access token.

Add a new user of the role Decision Maker to the database. Requires no login.

Args:
    form_data (Annotated[OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, Depends()]): The user credentials to add to the database.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): the database session.

Returns:
    JSONResponse: A JSON response

Raises:
    HTTPException: if username is already in use or if saving to the database fails for some reason.

Add a new user of the role Analyst to the database. Requires a logged in analyst or an admin.

Args:
    user: Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user)]: Logged in user with the role "analyst" or "admin".
    form_data: (Annotated[OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, Depends()]): The user credentials to add to the database.
    session: (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): the database session.

Returns:
    JSONResponse: A JSON response

Raises:
    HTTPException: if the logged in user is not an analyst or an admin or if
    username is already in use or if saving to the database fails for some reason.

get.description:
Get information on all the current user's problems.

Args:
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): the current user.

Returns:
    list[ProblemInfoSmall]: a list of information on all the problems.

schema.title: Response Get Problems Problem All Get

get.description:
Get detailed information on all the current user's problems.

Args:
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): the current user.

Returns:
    list[ProblemInfo]: a list of the detailed information on all the problems.

schema.title: Response Get Problems Info Problem All Info Get

post.description:
Get the model of a specific problem.

Args:
    request (ProblemGetRequest): the request containing the problem's id `problem_id`.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): the current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends): the database session.

Raises:
    HTTPException: could not find a problem with the given id.

Returns:
    ProblemInfo: detailed information on the requested problem.

Add a newly defined problem to the database.

Args:
    request (Problem): the JSON representation of the problem.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): the current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends): the database session.

Note:
    Users with the role 'guest' may not add new problems.

Raises:
    HTTPException: when any issue with defining the problem arises.

Returns:
    ProblemInfo: the information about the problem added.

Adds a problem to the database based on its JSON definition.

Args:
    json_file (UploadFile): a file in JSON format describing the problem.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): the usr for which the problem is added.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends): the database session.

Raises:
    HTTPException: if the provided `json_file` is empty.
    HTTPException: if the content in the provided `json_file` is not in JSON format.__annotations__

Returns:
    ProblemInfo: a description of the added problem.

Fetch specific metadata for a specific problem.

Fetch specific metadata for a specific problem. See all the possible
metadata types from DESDEO/desdeo/api/models/problem.py Problem Metadata
section.

Args:
    request (MetaDataGetRequest): the requested metadata type.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends]): the current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends]): the database session.

Returns:
    list[ForestProblemMetadata | RepresentativeNonDominatedSolutions]: list containing all the metadata
        defined for the problem with the requested metadata type. If no match is found,
        returns an empty list.

schema.title: Response Get Metadata Problem Get Metadata Post

post.description:
Assign a specific solver for a problem.

request: ProblemSelectSolverRequest: The request containing problem id and string representation of the solver
user: Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user): The user that is logged in.
session: Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]: The database session.

Raises:
    HTTPException: Unknown solver, unauthorized user

Returns:
    JSONResponse: A simple confirmation.

Return an interactive session with a given id for the current user.

Args:
    request (GetSessionRequest): a request containing the id of the session.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): the current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends): the database session.

Raises:
    HTTPException: could not find an interactive session with the given id
        for the current user.

Returns:
    InteractiveSessionInfo: info on the requested interactive session.

Runs an iteration of the reference point method.

Args:
    request (RPMSolveRequest): a request with the needed information to run the method.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): the current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends): the current database session.

Returns:
    RPMState: a state with information on the results of iterating the reference point method
        once.
Solve the problem using the NIMBUS method.
Initialize the problem for the NIMBUS method.
Save solutions.
Solve intermediate solutions by forwarding the request to generic intermediate endpoint with context nimbus.
Get the latest NIMBUS state if it exists, or initialize a new one if it doesn't.

schema.title: Response Get Or Initialize Method Nimbus Get Or Initialize Post

post.description:
An endpoint for finishing up the nimbus process.

Args:
    request (NIMBUSFinalizeRequest): The request containing the final solution, etc.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): The current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends): The database session.

Raises:
    HTTPException

Returns:
    NIMBUSFinalizeResponse: Response containing state id of the final solution.

Endpoint for deleting saved solutions.

Args:
    request (NIMBUSDeleteSaveRequest): request containing necessary information for deleting a save
    user (Annotated[User, Depends): the current  (logged in) user
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends): database session

Raises:
    HTTPException

Returns:
    NIMBUSDeleteSaveResponse: Response acknowledging the deletion of save and other useful info.

Starts the EMO method.

Args:
    request (EMOSolveRequest): The request object containing parameters for the EMO method.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends]): The current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends]): The database session.

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the request is invalid or the EMO method fails.

Returns:
    IterateResponse: A response object containing a list of IDs to be used for websocket communication.
        Also contains the StateDB id where the results will be stored.

Fetches results from a completed EMO method.

Args:
    request (EMOFetchRequest): The request object containing parameters for fetching results.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends]): The current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends]): The database session.

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the request is invalid or the EMO method has not completed.

Returns:
    StreamingResponse: A streaming response containing the results of the EMO method.

Fetches results from a completed EMO method.

Args:
    request (EMOFetchRequest): The request object containing parameters for fetching results and of the SCORE bands
        visualization.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends]): The current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends]): The database session.

Raises:
    HTTPException: If the request is invalid or the EMO method has not completed.

Returns:
    SCOREBandsResult: The results of the SCORE bands visualization.
Solve intermediate solutions between given two solutions.
Calculate SCORE bands parameters from objective data.

Request and receive the Utopia map corresponding to the decision variables sent.

Args:
    request (UtopiaRequest): the set of decision variables and problem for which the utopia forest map is requested
    for.
    user (Annotated[User, Depend(get_current_user)]) the current user
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]) the current database session
Raises:
    HTTPException:
Returns:
    UtopiaResponse: the map for the forest, to be rendered in frontend

Create group.

Args:
    request (GroupCreateRequest): a request that holds information to be used in creation of the group.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user)]): the current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): the database session.

Returns:
    JSONResponse: Aknowledgement that the gourp was created

Raises:
    HTTPException

Delete the group with given ID.

Args:
    request (GroupInfoRequest): Contains the ID of the group to be deleted
    user (Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user)]): The user (in this case must be owner for anything to happen)
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): The database session

Returns:
    JSONResponse: Aknowledgement of the deletion

Raises:
    HTTPException: Insufficient authorization etc.

Add a user to a group.

Args:
    request (GroupModifyRequest): Request object that has group and user IDs.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user)]): the current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): the database session.

Returns:
    JSONResponse: Aknowledge that user has been added to the group

Raises:
    HTTPException: Authorization issues, group or user not found.

Remove user from group.

Args:
    request (GroupModifyRequest): Request object that has group and user IDs.
    user (Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user)]): the current user.
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): the database session.

Returns:
    JSONResponse: Aknowledge that user has been removed from the group.

Raises:
    HTTPException: Authorization issues, group or user not found.

Get information about the group.

Args:
    request (GroupInfoRequest): the id of the group for which we desire info on
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): the database session

Returns:
    GroupPublic: public info of the group

Raises:
    HTTPException: If there's no group with the requests group id
Initialize the problem for GNIMBUS.

Get the latest results from group iteration.

Args:
    request (GroupInfoRequest): essentially just the ID of the group
    user (Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user)]): Current user
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): Database session.

Returns:
    GNIMBUSResultResponse: A GNIMBUSResultResponse response containing the latest gnimbus results

Raises:
    HTTPException: Validation errors or no results

Get all results from all iterations of the group.

Args:
    request (GroupInfoRequest): essentially just the ID of the group
    user (Annotated[User, Depends(get_current_user)]): current user
    session (Annotated[Session, Depends(get_session)]): current session

Returns:
    GNIMBUSAllIterationsResponse: A GNIMBUSAllIterationsResponse response
    containing all the results of the iterations. If last iteration was optimization,
    the first iteration is incomplete (i.e. the voting preferences and voting results are missing)

Raises:
    HTTPException: Validation errors or no results or no states and such.
Switch the phase from one to another. "learning", "crp", "decision" and "compromise" phases are allowed.
Get the current phase of the group.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the mutation operator.

mutation_probability.title: Mutation Probability
mutation_probability.description: The probability of mutation. Defaults to None, which sets the mutation probability to 1/<number of decision variables>.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the crossover operator.

alpha.title: Alpha
alpha.description: Non-negative blending factor 'alpha' that controls the extent to which offspring may be sampled outside the interval defined by each pair of parent genes. alpha = 0 restricts children strictly within the parents range, larger alpha allows some outliers.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the crossover operator.

lambda_.title: Lambda
lambda_.description: Positive scale Î» for the exponential distribution.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the mutation operator.

mutation_probability.title: Mutation Probability
mutation_probability.description:
The probability of mutation. Defaults to None, which sets the mutation probability to
1/<number of decision variables>.

name.title: Name
name.description: Clip the solutions to be within the variable bounds.

lower_bounds.title: Lower Bounds
lower_bounds.description: Lower bounds for the decision variables. If none, the lower bounds from the problem will be used.

upper_bounds.title: Upper Bounds
upper_bounds.description: Upper bounds for the decision variables. If none, the upper bounds from the problem will be used.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the termination operator.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Whether to use logical AND or OR.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the constant. This can be used in UI and visualizations. Example: 'maximum cost'.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Symbol to represent the constant. This will be used in the rest of the problem definition. It may also be used in UIs and visualizations. Example: 'c_1'.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the constraint. This can be used in UI and visualizations. Example: 'maximum length'.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Symbol to represent the constraint. This will be used in the rest of the problem definition. It may also be used in UIs and visualizations. Example: 'g_1'.

cons_type.description: The type of the constraint. Constraints are assumed to be in a standard form where the supplied 'func' expression is on the left hand side of the constraint's expression, and on the right hand side a zero value is assume. The comparison between the left hand side and right hand side is either and quality comparison ('=') or lesser than equal comparison ('<=').

is_linear.title: Is Linear
is_linear.description: Whether the constraint is linear or not. Defaults to True, e.g., a linear constraint is assumed.

is_convex.title: Is Convex
is_convex.description: Whether the function expression is convex or not (non-convex). Defaults to `False`.

is_twice_differentiable.title: Is Twice Differentiable
is_twice_differentiable.description: Whether the function expression is twice differentiable or not. Defaults to `False`

ConstraintTypeEnum.title: ConstraintTypeEnum
ConstraintTypeEnum.description: An enumerator for supported constraint expression types.

CreateSessionRequest.title: CreateSessionRequest
CreateSessionRequest.description: Model of the request to create a new session.

name.title: Name
name.description: Custom user-provided clusters.

clusters.title: Clusters
clusters.description: List of cluster IDs (one for each solution) indicating the cluster to which each solution belongs.

CustomClusterOptions.title: CustomClusterOptions
CustomClusterOptions.description: Options for custom clustering provided by the user.

name.title: Name
name.description: DBSCAN clustering algorithm.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the preferred ranges option.

aspiration_levels.title: Aspiration Levels
aspiration_levels.description: The aspiration levels as a dictionary with objective function symbols as the keys.

reservation_levels.title: Reservation Levels
reservation_levels.description: The reservation levels as a dictionary with objective function symbols as the keys.

method.title: Method
method.description: The method for handling the desirable ranges.

desirability_levels.title: Desirability Levels
desirability_levels.description: The desirability levels as a tuple (high, low). Used if method is DF transformation. If None, default levels (0.9, 0.1) are used.

DesirableRangesOptions.title: DesirableRangesOptions
DesirableRangesOptions.description: Options for providing desirable ranges for an EA.

name.title: Name
name.description: Clustering by one of the dimensions.

n_clusters.title: N Clusters
n_clusters.description: Number of clusters to use. Defaults to 5.

kind.title: Kind
kind.description:
Kind of clustering to use. Either "EqualWidth", which divides the dimension range into equal width intervals,
or "EqualFrequency", which divides the dimension values into intervals with equal number of solutions.
Defaults to "EqualWidth".

DimensionClusterOptions.title: DimensionClusterOptions
DimensionClusterOptions.description: Options for clustering by one of the objectives/decision variables.

DistanceFormula.title: DistanceFormula
DistanceFormula.description: Distance formulas supported by SCORE bands. See the paper for details.

problem_id.title: Problem Id
problem_id.description: Database ID of the problem to solve.

parent_state_id.title: Parent State Id
parent_state_id.description: State ID of the parent state, if any. Should be None if this is the first state in a session.

num_solutions.title: Num Solutions
num_solutions.description: Number of solutions to fetch. If 0, fetch all solutions.

EMOFetchRequest.title: EMOFetchRequest
EMOFetchRequest.description: Model of the request to fetch solutions from an EMO method.

problem_id.title: Problem Id
problem_id.description: Database ID of the problem to solve.

parent_state_id.title: Parent State Id
parent_state_id.description: State ID of the parent state, if any. Should be None if this is the first state in a session.

template_options.title: Template Options
template_options.description: Options for the template to use. A list of options can be given if multiple templates are used in parallel.

EMOIterateRequest.title: EMOIterateRequest
EMOIterateRequest.description: Model of the request to iterate an EMO method.

method_ids.title: Method Ids
method_ids.description: IDs of the EMO methods using websockets to get/send updates.

client_id.title: Client Id
client_id.description: Client ID to use when connecting to the websockets.

state_id.title: State Id
state_id.description: The state ID of the newly created state.

EMOIterateResponse.title: EMOIterateResponse
EMOIterateResponse.description: Model of the response to an EMO iterate request.

problem_id.title: Problem Id
problem_id.description: Database ID of the problem to solve.

parent_state_id.title: Parent State Id
parent_state_id.description: State ID of the parent state, if any.

config.description: Configuration for the SCORE bands visualization.

solution_ids.title: Solution Ids
solution_ids.description: List of solution IDs to score.

EMOScoreRequest.title: EMOScoreRequest
EMOScoreRequest.description: Request model for getting SCORE bands visualization data from state.

state_id.title: State Id
state_id.description: The state ID of the newly created state.

EMOScoreResponse.title: EMOScoreResponse
EMOScoreResponse.description: Model of the response to an EMO score request.

reachable_best_bounds.title: Reachable Best Bounds
reachable_best_bounds.description: Best bounds of the objective function values reachable from each intermediate point.

reachable_worst_bounds.title: Reachable Worst Bounds
reachable_worst_bounds.description: Worst bounds of the objective function values reachable from each intermediate point.

closeness_measures.title: Closeness Measures
closeness_measures.description: Closeness measures of each intermediate point.

reachable_point_indices.title: Reachable Point Indices
reachable_point_indices.description: Indices of the reachable points from each intermediate point.

ENautilusResult.title: ENautilusResult
ENautilusResult.description: The result of an iteration of the E-NAUTILUS method.

current_iteration.title: Current Iteration
current_iteration.description: The number of the current iteration.

selected_point.title: Selected Point
selected_point.description: The selected intermediate point. If first iteration, set this to be the (approximated) nadir point.

reachable_point_indices.title: Reachable Point Indices
reachable_point_indices.description: The indices indicating the point on the non-dominated set that are reachable from the currently selected point.

number_of_intermediate_points.title: Number Of Intermediate Points
number_of_intermediate_points.description: The number of intermediate points to be generated.

EnautilusStepRequest.title: EnautilusStepRequest
EnautilusStepRequest.description: Model of the request to the E-NAUTILUS method.

EndProcessPreference.title: EndProcessPreference
EndProcessPreference.description: A model for determining if everyone is happy with current solution so we can end the process.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the termination operator.

ExternalCheckTerminatorOptions.title: ExternalCheckTerminatorOptions
ExternalCheckTerminatorOptions.description: Options for external check terminator operator. Note that the check function must be provided separately.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the function. Example: 'normalization'.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Symbol to represent the function. This will be used in the rest of the problem definition. It may also be used in UIs and visualizations. Example: 'avg'.

is_linear.title: Is Linear
is_linear.description: Whether the function expression is linear or not. Defaults to `False`.

is_convex.title: Is Convex
is_convex.description: Whether the function expression is convex or not (non-convex). Defaults to `False`.

is_twice_differentiable.title: Is Twice Differentiable
is_twice_differentiable.description: Whether the function expression is twice differentiable or not. Defaults to `False`

ForestProblemMetaData.title: ForestProblemMetaData
ForestProblemMetaData.description: A problem metadata class to hold UTOPIA forest problem specific information.

FullIteration.title: FullIteration
FullIteration.description: A full iteration item containing results from a complete or incomplete iteration.

name.title: Name
name.description: Gaussian Mixture Model clustering algorithm.

scoring_method.title: Scoring Method
scoring_method.description:
Scoring method to use for GMM. Either "BIC" or "silhouette". Defaults to "silhouette".
This option determines how the number of clusters is chosen.

GMMOptions.title: GMMOptions
GMMOptions.description: Options for Gaussian Mixture Model clustering algorithm.

GNIMBUSAllIterationsResponse.title: GNIMBUSAllIterationsResponse
GNIMBUSAllIterationsResponse.description: The response model for getting all found solutions among others.

GNIMBUSResultResponse.title: GNIMBUSResultResponse
GNIMBUSResultResponse.description: The response for getting GNIMBUS results.

GNIMBUSSwitchPhaseRequest.title: GNIMBUSSwitchPhaseRequest
GNIMBUSSwitchPhaseRequest.description: A request for a certain phase. Comes from the group owner/analyst.

GNIMBUSSwitchPhaseResponse.title: GNIMBUSSwitchPhaseResponse
GNIMBUSSwitchPhaseResponse.description: A response for the above request.

reference_solution_1.description: The first solution used when computing intermediate solutions.

reference_solution_2.description: The second solution used when computing intermediate solutions.

GenericIntermediateSolutionResponse.title: GenericIntermediateSolutionResponse
GenericIntermediateSolutionResponse.description: The response from computing intermediate values.

GetSessionRequest.title: GetSessionRequest
GetSessionRequest.description: Model of the request to get a specific session.

GroupCreateRequest.title: GroupCreateRequest
GroupCreateRequest.description: Used for requesting a group to be created.

GroupModifyRequest.title: GroupModifyRequest
GroupModifyRequest.description: Used for adding a user into group and removing a user from group.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the selection operator.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the mutation operator.

mutation_probability.title: Mutation Probability
mutation_probability.description: The probability of mutation. Defaults to None, which sets the mutation probability to 1/<number of decision variables>.

InteractiveSessionBase.title: InteractiveSessionBase
InteractiveSessionBase.description: The base model for representing interactive sessions.

IntermediateSolutionRequest.title: IntermediateSolutionRequest
IntermediateSolutionRequest.description: Model of the request to solve intermediate solutions between two solutions.

name.title: Name
name.description: KMeans clustering algorithm.

n_clusters.title: N Clusters
n_clusters.description: Number of clusters to use. Defaults to 5.

n_points.title: N Points
n_points.description: The number of points to generate for the initial population.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the generator.

LHSGeneratorOptions.title: LHSGeneratorOptions
LHSGeneratorOptions.description: Options for Latin Hypercube Sampling (LHS) generator.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the crossover operator.

name.description: The name of the mutation operator.

mutation_probability.description: The probability of mutation. Defaults to None, which sets the mutation probability to 1/<number of decision variables>.

mutation_exponent.title: Mutation Exponent
mutation_exponent.description: Controls strength of small mutation (larger means smaller mutations).

name.title: Name

max_evaluations.title: Max Evaluations
max_evaluations.description: The maximum number of evaluations allowed.

MaxEvaluationsTerminatorOptions.description: Options for max evaluations terminator operator.

mutation_probability.description: The probability of mutation. Defaults to None, which sets the mutation probability to 1/<number of decision variables>.

MixedIntegerRandomMutationOptions.title: MixedIntegerRandomMutationOptions
MixedIntegerRandomMutationOptions.description: Options for Mixed Integer Random Mutation.

NIMBUSClassificationRequest.description: Model of the request to the nimbus method.

previous_objectives.description: The previous solutions objectives used for iteration.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the selection operator.

invert_reference_vectors.title: Invert Reference Vectors
invert_reference_vectors.description: Whether to invert the reference vectors (inverted triangle).

name.title: Name
name.description: Do not apply any repair to the solutions.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the non-preferred solutions option.

preference.title: Preference
preference.description: The non-preferred solutions as a dictionary with objective function symbols as the keys.

method.title: Method
method.description: The method for handling the non-preferred solutions.

NonPreferredSolutionsOptions.title: NonPreferredSolutionsOptions
NonPreferredSolutionsOptions.description: Options for providing non-preferred solutions for an EA.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the mutation operator.

mutation_probability.title: Mutation Probability
mutation_probability.description: The probability of mutation. Defaults to None, which sets the mutation probability to 1/<number of decision variables>.

max_generations.title: Max Generations
max_generations.description: Maximum number of generations in the evolutionary run. Used to scale mutation decay.

b.title: B
b.description: Non-uniform mutation decay parameter. Higher values causefaster reduction in mutation strength over generations.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the objective function. This can be used in UI and visualizations. Example: 'time'.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Symbol to represent the objective function. This will be used in the rest of the problem definition. It may also be used in UIs and visualizations. Example: 'f_1'.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The unit of the objective function. This is optional. Used in UIs and visualizations. Example: 'seconds' or 'millions of hectares'.

maximize.title: Maximize
maximize.description: Whether the objective function is to be maximized or minimized.

ideal.title: Ideal
ideal.description: Ideal value of the objective. This is optional.

nadir.title: Nadir
nadir.description: Nadir value of the objective. This is optional.

objective_type.description: The type of objective function. 'analytical' means the objective function value is calculated based on 'func'. 'data_based' means the objective function value should be retrieved from a table. In case of 'data_based' objective function, the 'func' field is ignored. Defaults to 'analytical'.

is_linear.title: Is Linear
is_linear.description: Whether the function expression is linear or not. Defaults to `False`.

is_convex.title: Is Convex
is_convex.description: Whether the function expression is convex or not (non-convex). Defaults to `False`.

is_twice_differentiable.title: Is Twice Differentiable
is_twice_differentiable.description: Whether the function expression is twice differentiable or not. Defaults to `False`

ObjectiveTypeEnum.title: ObjectiveTypeEnum
ObjectiveTypeEnum.description: An enumerator for supported objective function types.

OptimizationPreference.title: OptimizationPreference
OptimizationPreference.description: An optimization preference class. As for the method and phase, see GNIMBUS for details.

ParameterAdaptationStrategy.title: ParameterAdaptationStrategy
ParameterAdaptationStrategy.description: The parameter adaptation strategies for the RVEA selector.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the mutation operator.

mutation_probability.title: Mutation Probability
mutation_probability.description: The probability of mutation. Defaults to None, which sets the mutation probability to 1/<number of decision variables>.

p.title: P
p.description: Power distribution parameter. Controls the perturbation magnitude.

preference.description: The preferred solutions as a dictionary with objective function symbols as the keys.

PreferredSolutionsOptions.description: Options for providing preferred solutions for an EA.

ProblemGetRequest.description: Model to deal with problem fetching requests.

ProblemInfoSmall.description: Problem info request return data, but smaller.

ProblemMetaDataGetRequest.description: Request model for getting specific type of metadata from a specific problem.

ProblemSelectSolverRequest.title: ProblemSelectSolverRequest
ProblemSelectSolverRequest.description: Model to request a specific solver for a problem.

RPMSolveRequest.description: Model of the request to the reference point method.

name.description: The name of the selection operator.

parameter_adaptation_strategy.description: The parameter adaptation strategy to use.

alpha.title: Alpha
alpha.description: The alpha parameter in the angle penalized distance.

n_points.title: N Points
n_points.description: The number of points to generate for the initial population.

name.description: The name of the generator.

name.description: The name of the generator.

RandomMixedIntegerGeneratorOptions.title: RandomMixedIntegerGeneratorOptions
RandomMixedIntegerGeneratorOptions.description: Options for Random Mixed Integer generator.

ReferencePoint.title: ReferencePoint
ReferencePoint.description: Model for representing a reference point type of preference.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the reference point option.

preference.title: Preference
preference.description: The reference point as a dictionary with objective function symbols as the keys.

method.title: Method
method.description: The method for handling the reference point.

ReferencePointOptions.title: ReferencePointOptions
ReferencePointOptions.description: Options for providing a reference point for an EA.

adaptation_frequency.title: Adaptation Frequency
adaptation_frequency.description:
Number of generations between reference vector adaptation. If set to 0, no adaptation occurs. Defaults to 0.
Only used if no preference is provided.

creation_type.title: Creation Type
creation_type.description:
The method for creating reference vectors. Defaults to "simplex".
Currently only "simplex" is implemented. Future versions will include "s_energy".

If set to "simplex", the reference vectors are created using the simplex lattice design method.
This method is generates distributions with specific numbers of reference vectors.
Check: https://www.itl.nist.gov/div898/handbook/pri/section5/pri542.htm for more information.
If set to "s_energy", the reference vectors are created using the Riesz s-energy criterion. This method is used to
distribute an arbitrary number of reference vectors in the objective space while minimizing the s-energy.
Currently not implemented.

vector_type.title: Vector Type
vector_type.description: The method for normalizing the reference vectors. Defaults to "spherical".

lattice_resolution.title: Lattice Resolution
lattice_resolution.description:
Number of divisions along an axis when creating the simplex lattice. This is not required/used for the "s_energy"
method. If not specified, the lattice resolution is calculated based on the `number_of_vectors`. If "spherical" is 
selected as the `vector_type`, this value overrides the `number_of_vectors`.

number_of_vectors.title: Number Of Vectors
number_of_vectors.description:
Number of reference vectors to be created. If "simplex" is selected as the `creation_type`, then the closest
`lattice_resolution` is calculated based on this value. If "s_energy" is selected, then this value is used directly.
Note that if neither `lattice_resolution` nor `number_of_vectors` is specified, the number of vectors defaults to
200. Overridden if "spherical" is selected as the `vector_type` and `lattice_resolution` is provided.

adaptation_distance.title: Adaptation Distance
adaptation_distance.description: Distance parameter for the interactive adaptation methods. Defaults to 0.2.

reference_point.title: Reference Point
reference_point.description: The reference point for interactive adaptation.

preferred_solutions.title: Preferred Solutions
preferred_solutions.description: The preferred solutions for interactive adaptation.

non_preferred_solutions.title: Non Preferred Solutions
non_preferred_solutions.description: The non-preferred solutions for interactive adaptation.

preferred_ranges.title: Preferred Ranges
preferred_ranges.description: The preferred ranges for interactive adaptation.

ReferenceVectorOptions.title: ReferenceVectorOptions
ReferenceVectorOptions.description: Pydantic model for Reference Vector arguments.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the representative set.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the representative set. Optional.

solution_data.title: Solution Data
solution_data.description: The non-dominated solutions. It is assumed that columns exist for each variable and objective function. For functions, the `_min` variant should be present, and any tensor variables should be unrolled.

ideal.title: Ideal
ideal.description: The ideal objective function values of the representative set.

nadir.title: Nadir
nadir.description: The nadir objective function values of the representative set.

RepresentativeNonDominatedSolutions.title: RepresentativeNonDominatedSolutions
RepresentativeNonDominatedSolutions.description:
A problem metadata class to store representative solutions sets, i.e., non-dominated sets...

A problem metadata class to store representative solutions sets, i.e., non-dominated sets that
represent/approximate the Pareto optimal solution set of the problem.

Note:
    It is assumed that the solution set is non-dominated.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the scalar selection operator.

tournament_size.title: Tournament Size
tournament_size.description: The number of individuals participating in the tournament.

winner_size.title: Winner Size
winner_size.description: The number of winners to select (equivalent to population size).

RouletteWheelSelectionOptions.title: RouletteWheelSelectionOptions
RouletteWheelSelectionOptions.description: Options for roulette wheel selection operator.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description:
List of variable/objective names (i.e., column names in the data) to include in the visualization.
If None, all columns in the data are used. Defaults to None.

axis_positions.title: Axis Positions
axis_positions.description:
Dictionary mapping objective names to their positions on the axes in the SCORE bands visualization. The first
objective is at position 0.0, and the last objective is at position 1.0. Use this option if you want to
manually set the axis positions. If None, the axis positions are calculated automatically based on correlations.
Defaults to None.

clustering_algorithm.title: Clustering Algorithm
clustering_algorithm.description:
Clustering algorithm to use. Currently supported options: "GMM", "DBSCAN",
    and "KMeans". Defaults to "DBSCAN".

distance_formula.description: Distance formula to use. The value should be 1 or 2. Check the paper for details. Defaults to 1.

distance_parameter.title: Distance Parameter
distance_parameter.description:
Change the relative distances between the objective axes. Increase this value if objectives are placed too close
together. Decrease this value if the objectives are equidistant in a problem with objective clusters. Defaults
to 0.05.

use_absolute_correlations.title: Use Absolute Correlations
use_absolute_correlations.description: Whether to use absolute value of the correlation to calculate the placement of axes. Defaults to False.

include_solutions.title: Include Solutions
include_solutions.description:
Whether to include individual solutions. Defaults to False. If True, the size of the resulting figure may be
very large for datasets with many solutions. Moreover, the individual traces are hidden by default, but can be
viewed interactively in the figure.

include_medians.title: Include Medians
include_medians.description:
Whether to include cluster medians. Defaults to False. If True, the median traces are hidden by default, but
can be viewed interactively in the figure.

interval_size.title: Interval Size
interval_size.description:
The size (as a fraction) of the interval to use for the bands. Defaults to 0.95, meaning that 95% of the
middle solutions in a cluster will be included in the band. The rest will be considered outliers.

scales.title: Scales
scales.description:
Optional dictionary specifying the min and max values for each objective. The keys should be the
objective names (i.e., column names in the data), and the values should be tuples of (min, max).
If not provided, the min and max will be calculated from the data.

SCOREBandsConfig.title: SCOREBandsConfig
SCOREBandsConfig.description: Configuration options for SCORE bands visualization.

options.description: Configuration options used to generate the SCORE bands.

ordered_dimensions.title: Ordered Dimensions
ordered_dimensions.description:
List of variable/objective names (i.e., column names in the data).
Ordered according to their placement in the SCORE bands visualization.

clusters.title: Clusters
clusters.description: List of cluster IDs (one for each solution) indicating the cluster to which each solution belongs.

axis_positions.title: Axis Positions
axis_positions.description:
Dictionary mapping objective names to their positions on the axes in the SCORE bands visualization. The first
objective is at position 0.0, and the last objective is at position 1.0.

bands.title: Bands
bands.description:
Dictionary mapping cluster IDs to dictionaries of objective names and their corresponding band
extremes (min, max).

medians.title: Medians
medians.description: Dictionary mapping cluster IDs to dictionaries of objective names and their corresponding median values.

cardinalities.title: Cardinalities
cardinalities.description: Dictionary mapping cluster IDs to the number of solutions in each cluster.

SCOREBandsResult.title: SCOREBandsResult
SCOREBandsResult.description: Pydantic/JSON model for representing SCORE Bands.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the scalarization function.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Optional symbol to represent the scalarization function. This may be used in UIs and visualizations.

is_linear.title: Is Linear
is_linear.description: Whether the function expression is linear or not. Defaults to `False`.

is_convex.title: Is Convex
is_convex.description: Whether the function expression is convex or not (non-convex). Defaults to `False`.

is_twice_differentiable.title: Is Twice Differentiable
is_twice_differentiable.description: Whether the function expression is twice differentiable or not. Defaults to `False`

objs.title: Objs
objs.description: Array of objective names for each column

flip_axes.title: Flip Axes
flip_axes.description: Whether to flip axes based on correlation signs

ScoreBandsRequest.title: ScoreBandsRequest
ScoreBandsRequest.description: Model of the request to calculate SCORE bands parameters.

groups.title: Groups
groups.description: Cluster group assignments for each data point

ScoreBandsResponse.title: ScoreBandsResponse
ScoreBandsResponse.description: Model of the response containing SCORE bands parameters.

mutation_probability.title: Mutation Probability
mutation_probability.description: The probability of mutation. Defaults to None, which sets the mutation probability to 1/<number of decision variables>.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the crossover operator.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the simulator. This can be used in UI and visualizations.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Symbol to represent the simulator. This will be used in the rest of the problem definition. It may also be used in UIs and visualizations.

name.title: Name

name.description: The name of the crossover operator.

SinglePointBinaryCrossoverOptions.title: SinglePointBinaryCrossoverOptions
SinglePointBinaryCrossoverOptions.description: Options for Single Point Binary Crossover.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name to be given to the solution. Optional.

SolutionInfo.title: SolutionInfo
SolutionInfo.description: Used when we wish to reference a solution in some `StateDB` stored in the database.

name.title: Name
name.description: Optional name to help identify the solution if, e.g., saved.

solution_index.title: Solution Index
solution_index.description: The index of the referenced solution, if multiple solutions exist in the reference state.

state.description: The reference state with the solution information.

SolutionReference.title: SolutionReference
SolutionReference.description:
A model that functions as a reference to solutions existing in the database.

Referenced solutions are not necessarily solutions that the user has saved explicitly. For
referencing those, see `SavedSolutionReference`.

SolutionReferenceResponse.title: SolutionReferenceResponse
SolutionReferenceResponse.description: The response information provided when `SolutionReference` object are returned from the client.

optimal_objectives.title: Optimal Objectives
optimal_objectives.description: The objective function values corresponding to the optimal decision variables found.

constraint_values.title: Constraint Values
constraint_values.description: The constraint values of the problem. A negative value means the constraint is respected, a positive one means it has been breached.

extra_func_values.title: Extra Func Values
extra_func_values.description: The extra function values of the problem.

scalarization_values.title: Scalarization Values
scalarization_values.description: The scalarization function values of the problem.

success.title: Success
success.description: A boolean flag indicating whether the optimization was successful or not.

message.title: Message
message.description: Description of the cause of termination.

SolverResults.title: SolverResults
SolverResults.description: Defines a schema for a dataclass to store the results of a solver.

solver_string_representation.title: Solver String Representation
solver_string_representation.description: The string representation of the selected solver.

SolverSelectionMetadata.title: SolverSelectionMetadata
SolverSelectionMetadata.description:
A problem metadata class to store the preferred solver of a problem.

A problem metadata class to store the preferred solver of a problem.
See desdeo/tools/utils.py -> available_solvers for available solvers.

StateDB.title: StateDB
StateDB.description: State holder with a single relationship to the base State.

seed.title: Seed
seed.description: The seed for random number generation.

verbosity.title: Verbosity
verbosity.description: The verbosity level of the operators.

algorithm_name.title: Algorithm Name
algorithm_name.description: The unique name of the algorithm.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the template.

Template1Options.description:
Options for template 1.

Template 1 is used by methods such as NSGA-III and RVEA. See
[template1][desdeo.emo.methods.templates.template1] for
more details.

seed.description: The seed for random number generation.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the tensor representing the values. E.g., 'distances'

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Symbol to represent the constant. This will be used in the rest of the problem definition. Notice that the elements of the tensor will be represented with the symbol followed by indices. E.g., the first element of the third element of a 2-dimensional tensor, is represented by 'x_1_3', where 'x' is the symbol given to the TensorVariable. Note that indexing starts from 1.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the variable. This can be used in UI and visualizations. Example: 'velocity'.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Symbol to represent the variable. This will be used in the rest of the problem definition. Notice that the elements of the tensor will be represented with the symbol followed by indices. E.g., the first element of the third element of a 2-dimensional tensor, is represented by 'x_1_3', where 'x' is the symbol given to the TensorVariable. Note that indexing starts from 1.

variable_type.description: Type of the variable. Can be real, integer, or binary. Note that each element of a TensorVariable is assumed to be of the same type.

Tokens.title: Tokens
Tokens.description: A model for the authentication token.

name.description: The name of the scalar selection operator.

tournament_size.title: Tournament Size
tournament_size.description: The number of individuals participating in the tournament.

winner_size.description: The number of winners to select (equivalent to population size).

name.description: The name of the crossover operator.

url.description: A URL to the simulator. A GET request to this URL should be used to evaluate solutions in batches.

auth.title: Auth
auth.description: Optional. A tuple of username and password to be used for authentication when making requests to the URL.

UserPublic.title: UserPublic
UserPublic.description: The object to handle public user information.

UtopiaRequest.description: The request for an Utopia map.

is_utopia.title: Is Utopia
is_utopia.description: True if map exists for this problem.

options.title: Options
options.description: A dict with given years as keys containing options for each year.

years.title: Years
years.description: A list of years for which the maps have been generated.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the variable. This can be used in UI and visualizations. Example: 'velocity'.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Symbol to represent the variable. This will be used in the rest of the problem definition. It may also be used in UIs and visualizations. Example: 'v_1'.

variable_type.description: Type of the variable. Can be real, integer or binary.

initial_value.title: Initial Value
initial_value.description: Initial value of the variable. This is optional.

VariableDomainTypeEnum.title: VariableDomainTypeEnum
VariableDomainTypeEnum.description: An enumerator for the possible variable type domains of a problem.

VariableTypeEnum.title: VariableTypeEnum
VariableTypeEnum.description: An enumerator for possible variable types.
